skill.name: zinc-database
skill.description: Access ZINC (230M+ purchasable compounds). Search by ZINC ID/SMILES, similarity searches, 3D-ready structures for docking, analog discovery, for virtual screening and drug discovery.
skill.summary: Access ZINC (230M+ purchasable compounds). Search by ZINC ID/SMILES, similarity searches, 3D-ready s...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns were found. Network usage is limited to documented ZINC endpoints and file repositories.

content.user_title: Search ZINC compounds for screening and docking
content.value_statement: Finding purchasable compounds for screening can be slow and fragmented. This skill guides precise ZINC22 searches and retrieval workflows.
actual_capabilities: Look up compounds by ZINC ID with CartBlanche22 endpoints
Run SMILES similarity searches using dist and adist parameters
Retrieve random compound samples by subset and count
Query supplier catalog codes and map to ZINC IDs
Explain tranche fields and parsing for property filtering
Guide downloads of 3D structure files from files.docking.org
limitations: Does not download files or run network commands for you
Does not guarantee compound availability or data accuracy
Does not perform docking or cheminformatics calculations
Large dataset downloads may be slow or rate limited

use_cases.title: Build a docking library
use_cases.description: Collect drug-like or lead-like ZINC22 subsets and prepare inputs for docking workflows.

use_cases.title: Find purchasable analogs
use_cases.description: Search by SMILES and similarity to find vendor available analogs for hit expansion.

use_cases.title: Sample chemical space
use_cases.description: Generate random compound sets and filter by tranche properties for analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Find a ZINC ID
prompt_templates.prompt: Find ZINC000000000001 and return zinc_id and smiles using the ZINC22 API.

prompt_templates.title: Exact SMILES match
prompt_templates.prompt: Search ZINC22 for exact match of SMILES c1ccccc1 and return zinc_id and smiles.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity search
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a similarity search for ibuprofen SMILES with dist 3 and list zinc_id, smiles, catalogs.

prompt_templates.title: Random subset sample
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 1000 lead-like random compounds and request zinc_id, smiles, tranche fields.

output_examples.input: Find lead-like random compounds and explain the output fields.
output: Requested 1000 lead-like compounds from the random endpoint
Returned fields include zinc_id, smiles, and tranche for property filtering
Tranche encodes donors, logP, molecular weight, and reactivity phase

best_practices: Start with exact matches before expanding similarity distance
Request only needed output fields to reduce data size
Respect rate limits and cache frequent results
anti_patterns: Using very high distance values without clear goals
Requesting all fields for large result sets
Attempting massive downloads during peak hours

faq.question: Is this compatible with ZINC22 and ZINC20?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples focus on ZINC22, and URLs can be switched for ZINC20.

faq.question: What are the query limits?
faq.answer: ZINC does not publish strict limits, so use batching and delays for large jobs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with Python or RDKit?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides Python patterns for curl queries and parsing results.

faq.question: Does this skill access my local data?
faq.answer: No. It only documents ZINC endpoints and does not read local files.

faq.question: What if a query returns no results?
faq.answer: Check SMILES encoding, try a lower distance, or verify ZINC IDs.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual browsing?
faq.answer: It automates API queries and bulk workflows instead of manual web searches.
